critique: The document pertains to an amendment to Executive Order No. 9240, specifically addressing overtime wage compensation for work on customary holidays. It mandates time and one-half wage compensation for work performed on New Year's Day, Thanksgiving Day, Fourth of July, Christmas Day, Labor Day, and either Memorial Day or one other such holiday of greater local importance. This appears to be a labor regulation. There is no information about immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, or social inclusion. Therefore, these axes should be scored as neutral. The ideological tilt is slightly liberal as it protects worker compensation, but not strongly so.
